# xMagneticNorthZVertical

**Type Property**

A reference frame where the Z axis is vertical and the X axis points to the magnetic north pole.

## Declaration

```swift
static var xMagneticNorthZVertical: CMAttitudeReferenceFrame { get }
```

## Discussion

Use this option to determine the attitude of the device relative to magnetic north. For example, you might use this to implement a compass feature in your app. The [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMAttitude/yaw] (Z-axis) value in [doc://com.apple.coremotion/documentation/CoreMotion/CMAttitude] is `0` when the X axis is aligned with magnetic north.

The device must have a magnetometer and that sensor must be available. If the magnetometer isn’t currently calibrated, Core Motion prompts the person to move the device to calibrate it.

## Getting the reference frames

- **xArbitraryZVertical**: A reference frame where the Z axis is vertical and the X axis points in an arbitrary direction in the horizontal plane.
- **xArbitraryCorrectedZVertical**: A reference frame where the Z axis is vertical and has improved rotation accuracy, and the X axis points in an arbitrary direction in the horizontal plane.
- **xTrueNorthZVertical**: A reference frame where the Z axis is vertical and the X axis points to the geographic north pole.
